comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0

When visiting a page with many animated GIF objects, other graphical updating seems not to work well.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Make sure your PC is set to the fastest keyboard repeat rate by going to Control Panel -> Keyboard -> ...
2. Open Firefox and stay at a simple page with no animations etc.
3. Press Alt, release it and press the Down Arrow key to open the File menu.
4. Hold down the Right Arrow key, to see the menus open one after another. They move very quickly but are displayed correctly.
5. Now go to  http://www.emoticones.com/emoticonos_bananas.php
6. Again press Alt, release it, press Down Arrow key to open the File menu.
7. Hold down the Right Arrow key, to see the menus open one after another.
Actual Results:  
The dropdown menus are updating much slower than before, but the top row (menu bar) is updated quite quickly - leaving the dropdown lagging behind in a big mess.


Expected Results:  
Dropdown menus and menu bar items should behave consistently and be just as quick as before.
comments.creator: mr@analogue.org

comments.text:
This might be a Dupe of Bug 595671 (see Bug 595671 Comment 38 what covers your Symptoms).

Comment 5 Range oth is different than those in the other Report and might point to bug 512260 as Cause?!

Is your Issue reproducible when you disable the Hardware Acceleration (under Options/Advanced/General) and restart Firefox?

comments.raw_text:
In reply to comment #6. The issue is still reproducible with the HA disabled (less visible but still there)

Reproducible on the first "Nightly" build :) Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.2a1pre) Gecko/20110412 Firefox/4.2a1pre 

IMO Bug 595671 describes another issue and, for me bug 512260 is unclear what issue addresses.
I'm attaching a screenshot of this issue. I hope it's clear enough. If not I could attach a screen cast as well.
Basically the highlighting of the menu moves faster than the menu load, when holding down the right/left arrow keys
